```{r}
#Paired T-test:
#t.test(y1,y2,paired=TRUE) # where y1 & y2 are numeric
#Experiment - fear of statistics
edata<-read.table('experim.dat')
# Difference between FearFor our example:
t.test(edata$fost1,edata$fost2,paired=TRUE)

```
```{r}
#Non-parametric Repeated measure
#We are using the drink dataset again
drinkset<- read.csv("Field-BDI-Non-parametric.csv", header=TRUE)
#Need to split the file or subset it  and run against each sub-set
drinkxdata<-subset(drinkset,drinkset$drink=='DrinkX')
drinkydata<-subset(drinkset,drinkset$drink=='DrinkY')


summary(drinkxdata)
summary(drinkydata)
#Wilcoxon test syntax
#stats::wilcox.test(y1,y2,paired=TRUE)

stats::wilcox.test(drinkxdata$bdisun,drinkxdata$bdiwed,paired=TRUE)
stats::wilcox.test(drinkydata$bdisun,drinkydata$bdiwed,paired=TRUE)

```
